sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of travel outcome occurring on a trip
message_1: A person takes a trip and they can choose to travel by either plane, train or bus. The probability of their luggage being lost when traveling by plane is 0.1, when traveling by train is 0.05, and when traveling by bus is 0.02. What is the probability that if they travel by all 3 modes of transportation, their luggage will be lost at least once?
message_2:
To find the probability that their luggage will be lost at least once, we can first find the probability that their luggage will not be lost in any of the modes of transportation, and then subtract that from 1.

The probability of their luggage not being lost when traveling by plane is 1 - 0.1 = 0.9.
The probability of their luggage not being lost when traveling by train is 1 - 0.05 = 0.95.
The probability of their luggage not being lost when traveling by bus is 1 - 0.02 = 0.98.

The probability that their luggage will not be lost in any of the modes of transportation is the product of the individual probabilities:

0.9 * 0.95 * 0.98 = 0.8373

Now, we subtract this probability from 1 to find the probability that their luggage will be lost at least once:

1 - 0.8373 = 0.1627

So, the probability that their luggage will be lost at least once is 0.1627 or 16.27%.
